boolean check(int check) { for (int i : levels) { if (/*playerLevel[*/i/*]*/ < check) { return false; } else { return true; } } return false; }Just modify it.[/quote]Why are you looping through it all twice?

item.title: All 99s check
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Oh, well. I’m just gonna use it this way: if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("all99")){ if(check_all_skills(99) == true) { addItem(9120, 1); deathCape = 1; }else { sM("You need level 99 in all skills to get this"); } }boolean check_all_skills(int check) { for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) { if (playerLevel[i] == 99) { check++; } } if (check == 25) { return true; } else { return false; } }

Read full topic

item.title: All 99s check
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:4, topic:386993”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=482788.msg3535685#msg3535685 date=1300552836]

boolean check(int check) {
    for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) {
            check++;
    }
    if (check == 25) {
        return true;
    } else {
        return false;
    }
}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("all99")) {
        if (check()) {
                addItem(9120, 1);
                deathCape = 1;
                sM("You get your death cape!");
        } else {
                sM("you need level 99 in all skills to get a death cape!");
        }
}

try this.

I don’t see anything about a “99” though.
[/quote]Sorry, change the first piece of the code to this

boolean check(int check) { for (int i = 0; I < 25; i++) { if (playerLevel[i] == 99) { check++; } } if (check == 25) { return true; } else { return false; } } [/quote]
Not sure why you made a capital “I,” but I’ll see if it works.[quote=“I Vain I”][code=Java]
public class Main {

static int[] levels = new int[23];

public static void main(String[] args) {
    for (int i : levels) {
        if (!check(99)) {
            /* Send message */
        } else {
            /* Add shit */
        }
    }
}
static boolean check(int check) {
    for (int i : levels) {
        if (/*playerLevel[*/i/*]*/ < check) {
            return false;
        } else {
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

}[/code]Just modify that to your liking.[/quote]
Not so sure making a new class file would be the best way for such a small code.

Read full topic

item.description:

{
for(int i = 0; i < 25; i++)
{
if(playerLevel[i] == check)
{
return true;
}
}

        return false;
    }[/code]

Command:if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("all99")){ if(check_all_skills(99) == true) { addItem(9120, 1); deathCape = 1; }else { sM("You need level 99 in all skills to get this"); } }It gives a cape even if you have 1 99. I need it for all99s. Any help please?
